item.title: Timezone in JVM
item.description: I wrote a Scala code to get the current time. However, the output is different on the development server and docker. import java.util.Calendar println(Calendar.getInstance().getTime) On my development server, it outputs Sun Oct 18 18:01:01 CST 2020, but in docker, it print a UTC time. I guess it related to the timezone setting and do a research, here is the result. How Did JVM Detect Timezone All of the code can be found in this function: private static synchronized TimeZone setDefaultZone()
